## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
Hey, I'm curious about the current state of Verus. What's the current status of the Verus mainnet release?

**AI Assistant:**
The current status of the Verus mainnet release is not yet released. The focus is on protocol hardening and enabling usage first, followed by user experience upgrades and supporting infrastructure. The Verus PBaaS protocol is considered release candidate RC1 for the coming mainnet upgrade. We're getting close, but there's still some work to be done before the mainnet is ready.

**User:**
That's good to know. I'm also wondering about the supported operating systems. Is Debian 9 (Stretch) still supported by Verus?

**AI Assistant:**
No, Debian 9 (Stretch) is no longer supported by Verus. We've moved on to supporting more modern operating systems to ensure better security and performance.

**User:**
Okay, got it. I've also heard about the PBaaS capabilities. Are the PBaaS capabilities only available on the mainnet?

**AI Assistant:**
No, the PBaaS capabilities, including those for application development, are already available on the new Verus testnet. They will be available on the mainnet soon. You can start exploring and building on the testnet today, and then easily transition to the mainnet when it's released.
What's the current status of the Verus mainnet release?

The current status of the Verus mainnet release is not yet released. The focus is on protocol hardening and enabling usage first, followed by user experience upgrades and supporting infrastructure. The Verus PBaaS protocol is considered release candidate RC1 for the coming mainnet upgrade.

v0.9.3 RESETS TESTNET AND ADDRESSES ALL KNOWN ISSUES FOUND DURING TESTING ON THE NETWORK. FROM HERE, WE HOPE ALL COMMUNITY MEMBERS WILL JOIN IN TRYING OUT ALL FEATURES OF TESTNET TO HELP ENSURE THAT THE FINAL MAINNET RELEASE, WHICH WE ARE WORKING TOWARDS AS SOON AS IT IS CONSIDERED READY AND HARDENED, WILL BE BOTH SMOOTH AND WORLD-CHANGING.IF YOU HAVE ALREADY USED TESTNET WITH VERSIONS PRIOR TO v0.9.2, MAKE SURE TO DELETE AND CLEAR ANY EXISTING TESTNET DATA FOLDERS AS DESCRIBED BELOW.## Platform Support
- Debian 9 (Stretch) is no longer supported
## PROTOCOL RELEASE CANDIDATE RC1
With v0.9.3, The Verus PBaaS protocol, including networking, public blockchains as a service (PBaaS), VerusID extensions, and Verus DeFi, is considered release candidate RC1 for the coming mainnet upgrade. The core developer focus now remains on protocol hardening and enabling usage first, followed by user experience upgrades and supporting infrastructure such as identity and login support for lite mode, mobile and web extension wallets as well as merge mining for pool servers.## NEW PBAAS CAPABILITIES
All PBaaS capabilities, including for application development, are available now on the new Verus testnet. Now would be a good time for development capable projects hoping to get a head start on using Verus’s transformative technologies to do a deep dive on the Verus testnet. These new capabilities in v0.9.3, as well as all those we are familiar with, available nowhere else, will be on mainnet SOON(™):
Is Debian 9 (Stretch) still supported by Verus?
No, Debian 9 (Stretch) is no longer supported by Verus.
